description:
nova/volume/iscsi.py calls "/usr/sbin/tgt-admin" instead of just "tgt-admin"

rootwrap fails because in the "match" function, it compares the basename of the command with the full path, and therefore always returns False.

This is with the latest from "master" (commit 14ab37eb4174b8a1be8c5ff5e531cff5db3791c9)
title: rootwrap /usr/sbin/tgt-admin always returns 'Unauthorized command'

comments.content:
rootwrap fails because in the "match" function, it compares the basename of the command with the full path, and therefore always returns False.

This is with the latest from "master" (commit 14ab37eb4174b8a1be8c5ff5e531cff5db3791c9)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~avishay-il

comments.content:
No, this is not how this works...

1. Nova code contains utils.execute(['sleep', '5'], run_as_root=True)
2. Nova user calls "sudo /usr/bin/nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf sleep 5"
3. userargs[0] is 'sleep'
4. Filter has CommandFilter, /usr/bin/sleep
5. self.exec_path is therefore '/usr/bin/sleep', os.path.basename(self.exec_path) is 'sleep'
6. True, not False

If you still think there is a bug, please describe the symptoms rather than how you would fix it, and set back the status to New. Thanks !
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
When creating a volume, I get "Unauthorized command" for the following:

/usr/local/bin/nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf /usr/sbin/tgt-admin --conf /opt/stack/nova/volumes/volume-70beefcd-aedb-4af6-96d9-3be715259ab3 --update volume-70beefcd-aedb-4af6-96d9-3be715259ab3

From what I can tell, because it is calling tgt-admin with its full path, it is comparing "tgt-admin" to "/usr/sbin/tgt-admin", and failing.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~avishay-il

comments.content: The problem is actually in nova/volume/iscsi.py which calls "/usr/sbin/tgt-admin" instead of just "tgt-admin". You are not supposed to call those with full path.
